meanings.sent1: The soup was so insipid that I couldn't even finish it.
meanings.sent2: The plain rice was quite insipid without any seasoning.
meanings.sent3: The insipid salad was like eating a bowl of watered-down lettuce.
meanings.sent4: Her insipid cooking made the meal as dull as watching paint dry.
meanings.sent5: The insipid drink tasted like water with a hint of disappointment.

meanings.definition: Lacking in qualities that excite, stimulate, or interest
meanings.sent1: The movie was so insipid that I fell asleep halfway through.
meanings.sent2: The book turned out to be insipid, with a predictable plot.
meanings.sent3: His insipid jokes failed to make anyone laugh at the party.
meanings.sent4: The insipid conversation at the meeting made everyone yawn.
meanings.sent5: The insipid presentation was forgettable and unimpressive.
